channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: India Seems to Be Building Its Case for Striking Pakistan
item.description: As world powers face multiple crises, the one set off by a terror attack in Kashmir is getting scant attention, and little help de-escalating between ...

item.title: Turkey’s People Are Resisting Autocracy. They Deserve More Than Silence.
item.description: The world’s democracies can speak up to make Erdogan’s life less comfortable.

item.title: Washington’s Besieged Journalists Raise a Glass, Darkly
item.description: The annual weekend celebrating America’s free press went forward, even as the Trump administration chips away at press freedoms.

item.title: Cardinals Are Maneuvering Before Conclave To Elect Francis’ Successor
item.description: Some see the byword as a rallying call in a conservative campaign to reverse Francis’ push for a more inclusive church.

item.title: Europe’s Pharma Industry Braces for Pain as Trump Tariff Threat Looms
item.description: Medicines and chemicals are huge exports for European Union countries. That makes the sector a weak spot as trade tensions drag on.

item.title: Europe’s Pharma Industry Braces for Pain as Trump Tariff Threat Looms
item.description: Medicines and chemicals are huge exports for European Union countries. That makes the sector a weak spot as trade tensions drag on.

item.title: Why Australia Wants to Set Caps on International Students
item.description: Both major political parties are pledging steep cuts on the number of foreigners allowed to study in Australia as a way to rein in runaway housing pri...

item.description: As world powers face multiple crises, the one set off by a terror attack in Kashmir is getting scant attention, and little help de-escalating between ...

item.title: Cardinals Are Maneuvering Before Conclave To Elect Francis’ Successor
item.description: Some see the byword as a rallying call in a conservative campaign to reverse Francis’ push for a more inclusive church.

item.title: What’s at Stake in the Iran-U.S. Nuclear Talks
item.description: The third round of talks in three weeks raised hopes for an Iran nuclear accord, which could avert a new Mideast conflict. President Trump said he bel...

item.title: Silicon Valley’s intense energy demands for AI are making coal-fired power plants a hot-ticket item again
item.description: Tech companies are eyeing coal-fired power plants headed for retirement because of their connections to the grid that a new power plant could use.

item.title: Kevin Hart says there’s one thing still worth splurging on in this uncertain economy, regardless of income level
item.description: With consumer confidence down and market volatility up, Americans are tightening their belts right now.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr. tells East Europe to pick the U.S. over China for deals
item.description: Trump Jr. is holding a roadshow called “Trump Business Vision 2025.”

item.title: Tesla hikes Canadian prices and pushes its pre-tariff inventory
item.description: Tesla's Canadian website says: “Explore pre-tariff priced inventory while supplies last.”

item.title: Google says Chrome will suffer if it’s forced to sell the world’s most popular web browser
item.description: “I don’t think it could be recreated,” Chrome's general manager said about its success under Google.
